Authors: Slimani I., El Farissi I., Achchab S.
Title: Application of game theory and neural network to study the behavioral probabilities in supply chain
Abstract: As a review of game theoretic approach to optimize the logistic costs with the objective of modeling interactions among players in a basic supply chain, this paper focuses on a single channel, two-echelon supply chain with a retailer and his supplier of a one-product where careful attention is given to information sharing in general and demand forecasting in particular. Therefore, in the industrial world, firms cannot risk waiting for the actual demand to occur so they can react and determine the quantities to purchase, produce or deliver. Demand forecasts are important and necessary to any member of the supply chain as they gave them the advantage of planning and anticipating for future needs. However, demand forecasting is one of those crucial decisions where an error can cost too much. This is why we choose to implement the artificial neural network as a forecasting technique. Obviously the closest actor to the market i.e the retailer has the best view of demand levels than the supplier, so sharing demand information with the other actors has an impact on the performance of the whole supply chain but it is not necessarily the case since the retailer can choose to withhold this information. This is why we focus in this investigation on the demand’s prediction when information is not shared using the artificial intelligence of neural networks. © 2005 - 2015 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Asymmetric information; Demand forecasting; Demand uncertainty; Game theory; Neural network; Supply chain management

Authors: Toka A., Lenny Koh S.C., Shi V.G.
Title: Carbon footprint management for food supply chains: An integrated decision support system
Abstract: This chapter addresses carbon footprint management (CFM) for sustainable food supply networks. It provides a comprehensive analysis of the CF of contemporary global food networks, and proposes an integrated methodological approach. The proposed Decision Support System (DSS) could be employed by all involved stakeholders. The chapter first discusses the environmental impact of food supply networks. The most significant carbon hotspots arising across the entire food supply chain (FSC) echelons and critical CFM challenges are highlighted. Next, a holistic and practical evidence-based framework is proposed to aid the decision-making process for the decarbonization of FSCs. Then, the need for development of new tools for tackling CFM issues within complex food systems is addressed. Later, the application of supply chain environmental analysis tool (SCEnAT) is demonstrated through an illustrative case study motivated by a real-world UK wheat industry. Finally, interesting managerial insights are presented and practice-oriented low carbon interventions are discussed. © 2016 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Carbon footprint management; Food supply chains; Integrated decision support system; Supply chain environmental analysis
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Carbon footprint; Decision making; Environmental impact; Food supply; Supply chains; Complex food system; Comprehensive analysis; Decision making process; Decision support system (dss); Environmental analysis; Integrated decision; Methodological approach; Supply networks; Decision support systems

Authors: Lahmidani H., El Beqqali O.
Title: Role of supply chain management in improving the organization within Moroccan government
Abstract: This article describes the importance of supply chain management in optimizing the management of internal and external companies flows. The purpose of our research is to propose a new approach that is based on customer complaints. The list of complaints represent a data warehouse that will be operated via an information system and the datamining tool Tanagra to help the logistic managers making the right decisions in order to improve their procedures and methods. The role of this study will have as objective the improvement of the company's profit and customer satisfaction. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: claim; customers; information system; logistics; supply; Supply chain management; Tanagra
Index Keywords: Customer satisfaction; Data warehouses; Information management; Information systems; Intelligent systems; Logistics; Sales; claim; Customer complaints; customers; Data-mining tools; Logistic managers; New approaches; supply; Tanagra; Supply chain management

Authors: Shahriari K., Hessami A.G., Jadidi A., Lehoux N.
Title: An Approach Toward a Conceptual Collaborative Framework Based on a Case Study in a Wood Supply Chain
Abstract: To face the current economic context and better respond to market demand, many companies have started creating collaborations with different organizations inside and outside their supply chain. The objective is to have a greater visibility over supply chain operations, decision making and planning with positive impacts on the productivity and performance. In this paper, a collaborative framework is proposed to improve the business competitiveness of supply chains. Different dimensions including business and marketing, interfirm collaborative aspects, and quality and conformity in this framework are taken into account. Competence as an encompassing factor for human aspect to implement and operate the proposed framework is also scrutinized. All stated dimensions are then put together under one umbrella and implemented within a decision support system using online analytical processing database. The wood industry in Quebec North Shore region is chosen as an example of a supply chain and the case study throughout this paper. © 2015 IEEE.

Authors: Qiu L., Wang J., Wang Y.
Title: A decision support system for agricultural product supply chain
Abstract: Agricultural product supply chain assist decision support system is an important component of agricultural informatization and has great significance for the promotion of agricultural sustainable development and realization of agricultural modernization. The establishment of the assist decision support system can solve some long-standing problems that exist in agricultural product supply chain with scientific means. An agricultural product supply chain assist decision support system was proposed in this paper. The design of the system aims at designing an agricultural products supply chain assist decision support system which conforms to China's actual condition and solving some of the problems that exist in the demand, supply, production, processing and circulation sectors in current agricultural product supply chain. Copyright © 2015, AIDIC Servizi S.r.l.
